hasFocus

public boolean hasFocus()
This method will return true if the component currently has input focus in the GUI

Returns:
true if the component has input focus, otherwise false

getHotspot

public TerminalPosition getHotspot()
Description copied from interface: Interactable
When the component has keyboard focus, this method is called by the GUI system to figure out where should the cursor be positioned.

Specified by:
getHotspot in interface Interactable
Returns:
position of the cursor, in global coordinates, or null if the cursor should be hidden

setHotspot

protected void setHotspot(TerminalPosition point)
Sets the hotspot, in global coordinates, of where to put the text cursor when this component is active. If called with a null argument, the cursor will be hidden while this component has focus.

Parameters:
point - Global coordinates of the hotspot position for this component, or null if the cursor is to be hidden
